result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa R. Bartels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid during extended supervision.
To be paid during extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full time employment

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge, if not previously done.

No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known  where drugs can be obtained illegally.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Absolute sobriety.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Assessments, counseling and follow through as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt: DOC amendment to JOC and order - def has successfully completed the Earned Release Program

Defendant Melissa R. Bartels in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Defendant Melissa R. Bartels in custody.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:00 pm
ADA takes no issue with PSI
Atty Wallace takes no issue with PSI
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Wallace spks on sentencing
Helen Kitchen (def's mother) addresses Court
Defendant addresses Court
Court imposes:  3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision each count concurrent, but consecutive to Marinette County case 13CF239.  No credit.  Def is not eligible for CIP.  Def is eligible for SAP.  
Conditions:  
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & surcharge, if not previously done.
Costs & fees to be paid during extended supervision.
Assessment, counseling and follow through as directed by agent.
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known where drugs can be obtained illegally.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Absolute sobriety.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
